posts.title: React Requires Patience
posts.body: React has a steep learning curve, but it becomes much easier once you get the new syntax down.

posts.title: Function Names Matter
posts.body: Naming your functions well will make your code much easier to understand in the future.

posts.title: Professional Network
posts.body: Continue growing your network even after you land your first job so you will have a chance to hear about new future opportunities.

posts.title: LinkedIn Activity
posts.body: Make a checklist of quantifiable LinkedIn activities to complete (e.g. liking 3 network's accomplishments and posts, adding a comment to 2 discussions of people in your network, etc.) on a pre-determined basis (e.g. once per week, once per day, etc.).

posts.title: React Syntax
posts.body: React concepts are very similar to Vanilla JavaScript. The syntax is the main difference.

posts.title: Seek Additional Resources
posts.body: Many React concepts are explained well by programmers on YouTube. Sometimes hearing a second perspective on the learning materials can help solidify the concepts.
